title: Keep Your Pet Warm Indoors
description: Ensure your pet stays cozy during cold days by keeping them indoors and away from drafts. Provide a warm bed or blanket in a dry area.

title: Limit Outdoor Time
description: Shorten walks during extreme cold. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur quickly, especially in smaller or short-haired pets.

title: Protect Paws from Ice and Salt
description: Clean your pet’s paws after walks to remove harmful salt, chemicals, and ice. Consider using pet-safe boots or balms.

title: Avoid Overfeeding
description: Pets may be less active in winter, so monitor their diet to prevent weight gain. Adjust meals based on their activity level.

title: Provide Fresh Water
description: Make sure your pet’s water bowl doesn’t freeze. Hydration is just as important in winter as it is in summer.

title: Keep Up With Grooming
description: Don’t skip grooming during winter. Clean fur allows better insulation and prevents matting that traps moisture.

title: Create a Warm Sleeping Spot
description: Set up a cozy sleeping area away from cold floors or drafts. A raised bed with blankets helps retain warmth.

title: Watch for Signs of Cold Stress
description: Shivering, whining, or lethargy may mean your pet is too cold. Bring them indoors immediately if you notice these signs.
